properties.areaDesc: Limestone; Franklin; Jackson; Lincoln; Morgan; Franklin; Lauderdale; Colbert; Madison; Marshall; Moore; Cullman; DeKalb; Lawrence
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 10 at 2:40PM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
...Additional Heavy Rain Possible Tonight Into Tuesday Morning...

.A cold front will move slowly southeast through the Tennessee
Valley tonight. This will bring additional showers and a few
thunderstorms tonight into Tuesday morning, mainly south of the
Tennessee River. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches atop already
saturated soils will elevate the potential for flash flooding.

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of Alabama and southern middle Tennessee, including
the following areas, in Alabama, Colbert, Cullman, DeKalb,
Franklin AL, Jackson, Lauderdale, Lawrence, Limestone,
Madison, Marshall, and Morgan. In southern middle Tennessee,
Franklin TN, Lincoln, and Moore.

* Through Tuesday afternoon

* Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected with higher
amounts possible.

* This amount of rainfall will likely cause flash flooding and
areal flooding. Avoid low lying and poor drainage areas, and
be careful when approaching highway dips and underpasses.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don't drown!

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
